name: Millstone at Mellor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly welcome from staff working flat out on a busy Sunday afternoon.
reviews.title: Great to find pub serving lovely food on a Sunday evening

reviews.text: Functional clean room in new annexe building next to the pub. Very comfortable and quiet even though it overlooked the road.
reviews.title: Hospitality at it's best!

reviews.text: Restaurant had many different areas therefore accommodating for bigger groups and families. Our table for two was in the quieter bar area later in the evening. Food was beautifully presented and good quality local ingredients.
reviews.title: Quiet Location
Return back to the normal high standards
reviews.text: After our meal it was relaxing to sit in the bar. Sometimes we enjoy a game of cards on holiday but when we realised we’d forgotton our pack, the staff were only to happy to find us an alternative. The chef appeared with a couple of unusual wooden board games he’d picked up from his time in France. Very enjoyable stay.

Would thoroughly recommend this hotel. We chose this hotel due to previous reviews and weren't disappointed. The Hotel lived up to it's reputation as did the restaurant which has received critical acclaim. The food was outstanding as was the service. The staff were attentive without being obtrusive. The were very obliging and nothing was too much trouble.The bedrooms were very comfortable and nicely decorated with all the finishing touches. The only problem being, we had only booked for one night - wish we could have stayed longer!!! Will definitely return.
reviews.title: overnight stay with friends

reviews.text: Stayed here while on a business trip therefore we didn't pay for the room directly so I can't comment on the price of the room. What I can comment on is that we arrived late, just after the kitchen had closed and the staff were amazing, chef russeled up some sandwiches and some fish and chips for our party. First class service in my opinion. The rooms were very nice spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was also very nice with powerful shower. Breakfast was excellent, with all products locally sourced 10 out of 10. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Very very nice and great service

reviews.text: Thanks wes
reviews.title: Super food. A shame the service has slipped a little

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been going to the Millstone for years and sadly, whilst the food is always lovely (top marks to the chef) the service standards have slipped. We visited on Wednesday evening. Our first visit for a while as our last visit was disappointing due to poor service. The place was not too busy. Our order was taken swiftly and the food arrived twenty minutes later. All good, I thought. As usual, the food was excellent. After our meal the plates were taken promptly and we were asked if we wanted the sweet menu which we did. Unfortunately this is where the good service ended. After quite a while, too long in fact where no one came to take our order we gave up and paid the bill and left. I did want it to be better than our last visit, sadly it was not.
reviews.title: Great food and lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good food, spoilt by sloppy service.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.text: I came here with my wife for a Sunday evening meal last week. The location of the restaurant and the decor is of a high standard and the food on the menu is of a high quality with plenty to choose from and great portion sizes for good value. We decided not to have the Sunday Roast this time and sample some of the other delights available. The real ale on offer is fabulous and beer connoisseurs will be in their element. The young man behind the bar was very helpful with assisting me with some great choices!
reviews.title: Lovely family lunch

reviews.text: The hotel is approx. 20-30 minutes from the M6 J31, situated on the main road in the village of Mellor. This road did not get too much traffic and is therefore not very noisy.
reviews.title: Little gem.....

reviews.text: The main building hosts the reception, bar, restaurant and guest rooms with an annex building known as "The Courtyard" across the car park containing 6 additional rooms. Free parking is available for all hotel & restaurant guests so spaces can be limited at busy times. The front patio area offers use of wooden tables & benches for patrons.
reviews.title: Excellent Meal in Mellor

reviews.text: Check in after 2pm was efficient and the staff very friendly & polite. The décor was in keeping with the style of building and was well maintained.
reviews.title: Saved by Breakfast
Fantastic food and service
reviews.text: Room 232 in the annex was on the ground floor and was compact but provided all the facilities you would require: free Wi-Fi, satellite TV, clock / radio alarm, DAB radio, hairdryer, tea / coffee tray, trouser press, iron & board,complimentary mineral water & local baked biscuits. The bathroom was spacious and light with Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries for guest use.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served from 7 - 10am in the restaurant, which offers a good selection of hot / cold food which is well presented and very good quality. Lunch & dinner menus are comprehensive with a great wine & local ale selection for the discerning drinker. Speciality / in season, local dishes are available as additional choices to the main menu. The food was excellent, well presented and served promptly. The table service was very efficient & again the staff were all very friendly.
reviews.title: Hotel stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here as a couple whilst attending a wedding reception close by. The room was up a couple of flights of quite steep stairs and overlooked the car park. It was quite small but nicely furnished and the bathroom was clean, well appointed and functional.
reviews.title: Good, but could have been better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even as residents we were not able to get a table in the restaurant so we were seated in the bar area for dinner at a quite cramped table for two. We enjoyed our meal and the service was good.
reviews.title: Warm and welcoming with lovely atmosphere

reviews.text: However, the threesome at the next table were not happy, we sat down at 6.30pm and they had apparently ordered at 5.30pm and were still waiting for their food. I suspect they will not be back.
reviews.title: tremendous

reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent, both in terms of food quality and service. However, the two issues which marred our stay were with the room; it was so hot that we had to leave the window wide open all night, but the main gripe was the fact that the headboard was attached to the wall meaning that there was a gap between the wall and the bed, all night the pillows kept falling down the gap, they had to be pulled up so many times that we had a really disturbed night.
reviews.title: Delightful evening with good friends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For most people a hotel is about a good night's sleep, and as we had a very busy weekend ahead we really felt the lack of it. It was mentioned on check out and a couple of drinks were removed from our bill...I also sent an email on our return home, the response from the Chef Patron focused on the fact that the room was about to be refurbed and they would take account of our comments. Which, to be honest, and on reflection, was of little comfort to us.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable, professional, fantastic food

description: The Millstone has retained all the charm of the coaching inn it once was - but added all the creature comforts of a modern hotel. It is one of the highest rated AA 2 star hotels in the country and has been awarded 2 AA food rosettes. The Millstone at Mellor, Blackburn is easy to reach from the M6 or M65.
